description: Add a history of a ball value. A history is a table of floating point values assigned by sampling a model attribute periodically during a simulation. The ball must be specified by either 'id' or 'position' keyword.
syntax: ball history name <name> <keyword> id <i> or position <v>

keywords.name: position
keywords.description: Specify ball by position (finds nearest ball)

keywords.name: extra
keywords.description: Record extra variable at index i with specified type

keywords.name: stress
keywords.description: Record stress component (use quantity keyword to specify component)

examples.description: Record x-position of ball 1 with history name 'ball_pos'
Record z-velocity of ball 100 (auto-generated history name)
Record magnitude of unbalanced force on ball 5
Record displacement magnitude of ball nearest to origin

examples.command: ball history extra index 1 type float id 10
examples.description: Record extra variable at index 1 (float type) for ball 10

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('ball history ...') or manually record values using itasca.set_callback() with Ball getter methods
